Interface IPlayerData

public interface IPlayerData
Persistent data record for a single player in the ProudCore system.

IPlayerData provides both read and write access to the player-specific values that feed into the clan and territory systems. All mutations are automatically validated and scheduled for persistence; callers do not need to invoke any explicit save method after modifying values through this interface.

Power system

Power is the core resource that controls territorial influence:

  • Each player has a current power value capped by their maximum power.
  • A clan's total power is the sum of all its members' current power values, and governs how many chunks the clan may claim.
  • Power is reduced by takePower(double) on death and restored over time or by administrative action.
  • Both the current and maximum values can be overridden programmatically (e.g. by rank plugins or admin commands) via the setter methods.

Chunk limit

In addition to power-based claim limits, each player may have a personal chunk limit (getChunkLimit()) that acts as a hard cap on the number of chunks they can individually hold, independent of power.

Usage example

IPlayerData data = playerManager.getPlayer(playerUuid);

System.out.printf("Power: %.1f / %.1f%n", data.getPower(), data.getMaxPower());

// Reward a player on a kill streak
data.addPower(5.0);

// Penalise a player on death
data.takePower(3.0);
Since:
1.0
See Also:

  • IClan

  • Method Details

    • getUuid

      UUID getUuid()
      Returns the player's unique identifier.

      This UUID is immutable and corresponds directly to the Bukkit/Mojang player UUID. It is used as the primary key for all storage and cache lookups.

      Returns:
      the non-null UUID that uniquely identifies this player

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns the player's most recently known username.

      This value is refreshed automatically every time the player connects to the server. It may therefore lag behind by one session for players who have changed their Minecraft username since their last login.

      Returns:
      the non-null last-known username of the player

    • getPower

      double getPower()
      Returns the player's current power.

      The value is always in the range [0, getMaxPower()]. It represents the player's individual contribution to their clan's total power pool, and therefore directly affects how many territorial chunks the clan can hold.

      Returns:
      the current power value; always >= 0 and <= getMaxPower()
      See Also:
      • getMaxPower()

    • getMaxPower

      double getMaxPower()
      Returns the player's maximum power cap.

      Current power can never exceed this value. The cap can be raised or lowered by permission plugins, rank systems, or direct administrative calls to setMaxPower(double).

      Returns:
      the maximum power value; always > 0
      See Also:
      • getPower()

    • getChunkLimit

      int getChunkLimit()
      Returns the maximum number of chunks this player is personally allowed to claim.

      This is an independent cap that operates alongside (but separately from) the power-based claim limit. It is typically managed by permission tiers or donor rank plugins. A value of 0 means the player cannot personally claim any chunks.

      Returns:
      the personal chunk-claim limit; always >= 0

    • setPower

      void setPower(double power)
      Sets the player's current power to the specified value.

      The provided value is automatically clamped to the range [0, getMaxPower()]: values below zero are treated as zero, and values above the maximum are silently reduced to the maximum. The change is scheduled for persistence automatically.

      Parameters:
      power - the desired power value; clamped to [0, getMaxPower()]

    • setMaxPower

      void setMaxPower(double maxPower)
      Sets the player's maximum power cap.

      If the player's current power exceeds the new maximum, it is automatically reduced to match. Setting this value below the current power effectively applies an immediate setPower(double) as a side effect. Changes are persisted automatically.

      Parameters:
      maxPower - the new maximum power; must be > 0

    • setChunkLimit

      void setChunkLimit(int chunkLimit)
      Sets the player's personal chunk-claim limit.

      This directly overrides the current limit. Typically used by rank or permission plugins to grant additional claiming capacity. The change is persisted automatically.

      Parameters:
      chunkLimit - the new chunk-claim limit; must be >= 0

    • addPower

      void addPower(double amount)
      Increases the player's current power by the given amount.

      The resulting power is capped at getMaxPower(); any surplus is silently discarded. Negative or zero values are ignored and produce no change. The update is persisted automatically.

      // Grant 10 power on capturing a flag
data.addPower(10.0);
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to add; values <= 0 are ignored
      See Also:
      • takePower(double)

    • takePower

      void takePower(double amount)
      Decreases the player's current power by the given amount.

      The resulting power cannot fall below 0; any excess reduction is silently clamped. Negative or zero values are ignored and produce no change. The update is persisted automatically. This method is typically called in response to player death events.

      // Penalise 3 power on death
data.takePower(3.0);
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to remove; values <= 0 are ignored
      See Also:
      • addPower(double)
